intro: Calyptrella gracilis var. ovata, commonly known as the slender calyptrella, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, elongated leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests or understorey habitats. Its flowers are often visited by native bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological importance. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
